text:
Linn is a city in Washington County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 410 people lived there.
History.
Linn was founded in 1877. It was named after Lewis F. Linn, a U.S. Senator from Missouri.
The first post office in Linn was founded in January 1878.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 410 people, 152 households, and 97 families living in the city.
